main event: Multiple witnesses observed unidentified objects in the sky over New Jersey on March 6 and March 15, 1950.
interesting points: Several witnesses described three luminous round forms moving intelligently in the sky., A witness reported a dull metallic grey object about 30 feet in diameter., Observations noted that the objects were high altitude with no sound and left vapor trails., Witnesses included reliable citizens and individuals with backgrounds in engineering and military intelligence., Different descriptions of the objects varied, including colors and shapes, indicating a range of eyewitness perceptions.
sighted object: three luminous round forms and a dull metallic grey object
witness description: Reliable citizens in various professions, including a housewife and an engineer
